text:
How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, has had a beneficial impact on dating, with some provisos.   I think it has made it easier to meet people, especially if you are shy or introverted, or you are in a situation where it is difficult to meet people, due to working hours, or family commitments.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, has had a beneficial impact on dating, with some provisos.   I think it has made it easier to meet people, especially if you are shy or introverted, or you are in a situation where it is difficult to meet people, due to working hours, or family commitments.   It has also made it easier to communicate with people you have met, and to get to know them better.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, has had a beneficial impact on dating, with some provisos.   I think it has made it easier to meet people, especially if you are shy or introverted, or you are in a situation where it is difficult to meet people, due to working hours, or family commitments.   Another positive is that it has opened up a far broader range of people to meet, rather than just those you work with or meet in social situations.

Another positive is that it has opened up a far broader range of people to meet, rather than just those you work with or meet in social situations.   It has also made it easier to communicate with people, and to get to know them before you meet them.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, has had a beneficial impact on dating, with some provisos.   I think it has made it easier to meet people, especially if you are shy or introverted, or you are in a situation where it is difficult to meet people, due to working hours, or family commitments.   Another positive is that it has opened up a far broader range of people to meet, rather than just those you work with or meet in social situations.   It has also made it easier to communicate with people, and to get to know them before you meet them.  You have now, usually, been pre matched with people that are similar to you, with shared interests and views.

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, has had a beneficial impact on dating, with some provisos.   I think it has made it easier to meet people, especially if you are shy or introverted, or you are in a situation where it is difficult to meet people, due to working hours, or family commitments.   Another positive is that it has opened up a far broader range of people to meet, rather than just those you work with or meet in social situations.   It has also made it easier to communicate with people, and to get to know them before you meet them.  You have now, usually, been pre matched with people that are similar to you, with shared interests and views.   This can be a good thing, but it can also be a bad thing.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, has had a beneficial impact on dating, with some provisos.   I think it has made it easier to meet people, especially if you are shy or introverted, or you are in a situation where it is difficult to meet people, due to working hours, or family commitments.   Another positive is that it has opened up a far broader range of people to meet, rather than just those you work with or meet in social situations.   It has also made it easier to communicate with people, and to get to know them before you meet them.  You have now, usually, been pre matched with people that are similar to you, with shared interests and views.   This can be a good thing, but it can also be a bad thing.  There are those that just use the apps for causal relationships when others are looking for something more permanent.

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, has had a beneficial impact on dating, with some provisos.   I think it has made it easier to meet people, especially if you are shy or introverted, or you are in a situation where it is difficult to meet people, due to working hours, or family commitments.   Another positive is that it has opened up a far broader range of people to meet, rather than just those you work with or meet in social situations.   It has also made it easier to communicate with people, and to get to know them before you meet them.  You have now, usually, been pre matched with people that are similar to you, with shared interests and views.   This can be a good thing, but it can also be a bad thing.  There are those that just use the apps for causal relationships when others are looking for something more permanent.   There are also those that use the apps to find a partner for a one night stand.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, has had a beneficial impact on dating, with some provisos.   I think it has made it easier to meet people, especially if you are shy or introverted, or you are in a situation where it is difficult to meet people, due to working hours, or family commitments.   Another positive is that it has opened up a far broader range of people to meet, rather than just those you work with or meet in social situations.   It has also made it easier to communicate with people, and to get to know them before you meet them.  You have now, usually, been pre matched with people that are similar to you, with shared interests and views.   This can be a good thing, but it can also be a bad thing.  There are those that just use the apps for causal relationships when others are looking for something more permanent.   There are also those that use the apps to find a partner for a one night stand.  The pre sorting also means that you might not get to experience people from varied backgrounds.  People also judge people on appearance on the apps, making spur of the moment decisions on someone's appearance, rather than getting to know the true person and developing a relationship that way.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, has had a beneficial impact on dating, with some provisos.   I think it has made it easier to meet people, especially if you are shy or introverted, or you are in a situation where it is difficult to meet people, due to working hours, or family commitments.   Another positive is that it has opened up a far broader range of people to meet, rather than just those you work with or meet in social situations.   It has also made it easier to communicate with people, and to get to know them before you meet them.  You have now, usually, been pre matched with people that are similar to you, with shared interests and views.   This can be a good thing, but it can also be a bad thing.  There are those that just use the apps for causal relationships when others are looking for something more permanent.   There are also those that use the apps to find a partner for a one night stand.  The pre sorting also means that you might not get to experience people from varied backgrounds.  People also judge people on appearance on the apps, making spur of the moment decisions on someone's appearance, rather than getting to know the true person and developing a relationship that way.   I think that the apps have also made it easier for people to be dishonest, and to lie about their age, or their appearance.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, has had a beneficial impact on dating, with some provisos.   I think it has made it easier to meet people, especially if you are shy or introverted, or you are in a situation where it is difficult to meet people, due to working hours, or family commitments.   Another positive is that it has opened up a far broader range of people to meet, rather than just those you work with or meet in social situations.   It has also made it easier to communicate with people, and to get to know them before you meet them.  You have now, usually, been pre matched with people that are similar to you, with shared interests and views.   This can be a good thing, but it can also be a bad thing.  There are those that just use the apps for causal relationships when others are looking for something more permanent.   There are also those that use the apps to find a partner for a one night stand.  The pre sorting also means that you might not get to experience people from varied backgrounds.  People also judge people on appearance on the apps, making spur of the moment decisions on someone's appearance, rather than getting to know the true person and developing a relationship that way.   I think that the apps have also made it easier for people to be dishonest, and to lie about their age, or their appearance.  However, there have always been some issues with dating, and the benefits for those looking to find a partner far outweigh the negatives.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, has had a beneficial impact on dating, with some provisos.   I think it has made it easier to meet people, especially if you are shy or introverted, or you are in a situation where it is difficult to meet people, due to working hours, or family commitments.   Another positive is that it has opened up a far broader range of people to meet, rather than just those you work with or meet in social situations.   It has also made it easier to communicate with people, and to get to know them before you meet them.  You have now, usually, been pre matched with people that are similar to you, with shared interests and views.   This can be a good thing, but it can also be a bad thing.  There are those that just use the apps for causal relationships when others are looking for something more permanent.   There are also those that use the apps to find a partner for a one night stand.  The pre sorting also means that you might not get to experience people from varied backgrounds.  People also judge people on appearance on the apps, making spur of the moment decisions on someone's appearance, rather than getting to know the true person and developing a relationship that way.   I think that the apps have also made it easier for people to be dishonest, and to lie about their age, or their appearance.  However, there have always been some issues with dating, and the benefits for those looking to find a partner far outweigh the negatives.   I think that dating apps are a good thing, and I would recommend them to anyone.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion, has had a beneficial impact on dating, with some provisos.   I think it has made it easier to meet people, especially if you are shy or introverted, or you are in a situation where it is difficult to meet people, due to working hours, or family commitments.   Another positive is that it has opened up a far broader range of people to meet, rather than just those you work with or meet in social situations.   It has also made it easier to communicate with people, and to get to know them before you meet them.  You have now, usually, been pre matched with people that are similar to you, with shared interests and views.   This can be a good thing, but it can also be a bad thing.  There are those that just use the apps for causal relationships when others are looking for something more permanent.   There are also those that use the apps to find a partner for a one night stand.  The pre sorting also means that you might not get to experience people from varied backgrounds.  People also judge others on appearance on the apps, making spur of the moment decisions on someone's appearance, rather than getting to know the true person and developing a relationship that way.   I think that the apps have also made it easier for people to be dishonest, and to lie about their age, or their appearance.  However, there have always been some issues with dating, and the benefits for those looking to find a partner far outweigh the negatives.   So, all in all, I think that dating apps are a good thing, and I would recommend them to anyone.
